directions: If desired, lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.

In a large fry pan over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Working in batches, brown the chicken on both sides, 8 to 10 minutes per batch. Transfer to a slow cooker and add the braising sauce. Cover and cook on high according to the manufacturer’s instructions until the chicken is fork-tender, about 2 hours.

Preheat an oven to 325°F. In a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil and brown the chicken as directed above. Return all the chicken to the pot, add the braising sauce and bring to a simmer. Cover the pot with a lid, transfer to the oven and cook until the chicken is fork-tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste (optional)
1 jar (1 lb. 3.5 oz.) madras vegetable curry braising sauce
title: Chicken Braised with Madras Vegetable Curry Sauce
